item.title: JavaScript Learning
item.description: JavaScript Variables & Data Types var, let, const var: globally scope let: variable const: constant variable Always use const unless you know you will reassign the value, then use let. String, Numbers, Boolean, null, undefined 1const name = 'John' 2const age = 30; 3const isCool = true; 4const x = null; 5const y = undefined; 6let z; 7console.log(typeof name); String - Concatenation 1console.log('My name is ' + name + ' and I am ' + age); 2// Template String 3// Note: it's `` symbol not '' 4const hello = `My name is ${name} and I am ${age}`; 5console.
